DataElement.preferredName: Person Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Regimen Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was disease recurrence and/or progression following platinum-based chemotherapy regimen as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Regimen Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to disease recurrence and/or progression following platinum-based chemotherapy regimen as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Regimen Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Inorganic compounds which contain platinum as the central atom.:Drug therapy using two or more drugs given together or separately for a combined effect.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Cancer that continues to grow or spread.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A chemotherapy compound that contains a platinum atom. Platinum compounds do not contain alkyl groups but do cause DNA crosslinks and adducts similar to alkylating agents. DNA crosslinks and adducts ultimately lead to the induction of apoptosis.
A combination of multiple drugs used in standard or clinical trial treatments. The order, dosage or dosing interval of the individual ingredients may not be specified.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient have a docume
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a documented recurrence (or disease progression) following (or during) her most recent course of platinum-based chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has there been progression in any site following induction/first-line chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has there been progression in any site following induction/first-line systemic therapy?
